data.title: Why This Nobel-Winning Banker Faces Life Imprisonment in Bangladesh
data.meta_description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how microcredit pioneer Muhammad Yunus went from winning the Nobel Peace Prize to facing life imprisonment.
data.text:
On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how microcredit pioneer Muhammad Yunus went from winning the Nobel Peace Prize to facing life imprisonment.

Never miss an episode. Follow The Big Take Asia podcast today.

Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus pioneered micro loans as a tool to fight poverty. Now prosecutors in Bangladesh have linked him and his colleagues to a dizzying number of crimes, including embezzlement and laundering millions of dollars.
